boardgame.name: The Battle for Normandy
boardgame.description: From the GMT Website:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The Battle for Normandy is a game that represents the climactic campaign in Normandy from D-Day, 6 June 1944 to the first week of August 1944 at primarily battalion level. Numerous scenarios are included to play out various smaller battles in Normandy. It is intended for two players or player teams._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game uses a unique sequence of play and a system of fire combat throughout the airdrop and beach assault phases with company-level breakdown units, then a more traditional odds-type combat approach throughout the rest of the game. Initial beach defense deployments at start and daily air support and defense allocations, hidden to the opposing player; create a level of uncertainty that makes for a tense, challenging duel._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game combines a detailed, extensively researched order of battle with relatively fast-playing game mechanics to make it not only the largest representation of the Normandy campaign available to date, but a manageable one that is meant to be played, not shelved. Scenarios include _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;lsquo;Bloody Omaha_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;, _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;lsquo;Operation Epsom_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;, _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;lsquo;Cobra_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;, _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;lsquo;The Fight for Cherbourg_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo; and more._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;A future expansion will extend the play area south, to include the Mortain and Falaise scenarios, and extend the campaign to late August and the 3rd Army breakout._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Game Equipment: _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; One Rule Book _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; One Scenario Book _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Five (5) 22x34_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rdquo; full color Maps _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Nine (9) full color counter sheets _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 8-1/2x11_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rdquo; Allied Air Allocation Log (laminated) _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 8-1/2x11_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rdquo; Axis AAA Allocation Log (laminated) _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 11x17_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rdquo; Turn Record Track _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 8-1/2x11_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rdquo; Terrain Effects Chart (x2) _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 8-1/2x11_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rdquo; Repl/Recon/Weather chart (x2) _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 8-1/2x11_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rdquo; German Record Track _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 8-1/2x11_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rdquo; Allied Record Track _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 8-1/2x11_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rdquo; Combat Results Table (x2) _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Dice - 3d6 and 1d10 _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

GMT Games (GMT 0912) The Battle for Normandy is a game that represents the climactic campaign in Normandy from D-Day, 6 June 1944 to the first week of August 1944 at primarily battalion level. Numerous scenarios are included to play out various smaller battles in Normandy. It is intended for two players or player teams. The game uses a unique sequence of play and a system of fire combat throughout the airdrop and beach assault phases with company-level breakdown units, then a more traditional odds-type combat approach throughout the rest of the game. Initial beach defense deployments at start and daily air support and defense allocations, hidden to the opposing player; create a level of uncertainty that makes for a tense, challenging duel. The game combines a detailed, extensively researched order of battle with relatively fast-playing game mechanics to make it not only the largest representation of the Normandy campaign available to date, but a manageable one that is meant to be played, not shelved. Scenarios include: (As of March 11, 2008 - we are working on a couple more): Campaign : 5 maps, 6 June - 10 Aug Bloody Omaha : part of one map, 6 June - 10 June Cobra : 2 maps (most of play on one though), 25 July - 31 July Goodwood _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Cobra (combined): 4 maps, 18 July - 31 July Operation Epsom : 1 map, 26 June - 1 July The Battle for Cherbourg : 1 map, 18 June - 27 June

This is for the base game. It has been opened but is unpunched, complete and in unplayed condition from a smoke free home. The box has some rubbing and some very slight wear. But, otherwise is in excellent condition. I also have the expansion for sale for $30.00 in like new condition (this is in a ziplock bag - as received from GMT). Also included are the components related to Battle for Normandy from the C3i 24. This includes some additional counters and play aids (not the entire issue - just the components related to BfN). DISCOUNT NOTE: If you purchase both the base and expansion, I will reduce the total by $10.00 - for a game cost of $120 for the base, expansion and the C3i 24 components noted above. Buyer to pay priority mail medium flat rate shipping of $12.65 plus paypal fees.
